dialogs.text: Ew, is that a slug? You are not taking one step into this cafeteria, buddy.

choices.text: I really need to get to something from the cafeteria.
c'mon, bro, i really gotta get something from there

dialogs.text: Ew, you sound even worse than that slug right now.
RevealResults11 You sound real trustworthy now! I guess more people would trust a sophisticated gent than a fellow bro. Too bad, cuz I've been brushing up on my slang. No cap.
...Ok, but you literally have a slug on your head.

choices.text: So you're just not going to let in any animals at all?
What if this is my service slug? That's very unfair of you to not let it in.
Slug slime is actually very sanitary. No harm will be done.

dialogs.text: That's not just any animal, that's literally a slimy, disguisting slug. Slime is not allowed in the cafeteria. Sorry, I don't make the rules. Actually, I do. I just made that one.
RevealResults21 Looks like your straw man argument doesn't work. That's a shame, it was very tricky.
Yeah, I don't care. Find a service rat or something and maybe I'll consider it. We need some better chefs here.
RevealResults16 I don't think they feared your cancel attempt, but nice try. Real life is very different than the internet. And, obviously, this is all real.
Don't think for a second I'll believe that. But you seem pitifully desperate, so I'll trust you to be careful, just this once.

RevealResults19 Wow, I was certain they would get mad! It guess humans are slightly more level-headed than I thought. Slugs are actually faster than humans, though. You just can't see it because we're going so fast.
RevealResults21 Looks like the straw man argument wouldn't have worked. That's a shame, exaggerating their own words would be very tricky.
RevealResults16 So they wouldn't have even feared your cancel attempt. Real life is very different than the internet. And, obviously, this is all real.
